I'll stand with Stephanie at the front door and one of us will take the elevator up to 4 with the guest where Liz will be sitting/checking people in. Should make for a cohesive "experience". I'll be putting foamcore up in the storage flex space to hide the mess at 2pm.

<!here|@here>: is there any chance we could have someone buy us some black spraypaint?
or should we maybe just put that idea to bed?
Sorry I feel like I missed something, is this to spray paint the caps? I can go pick some up.
it was a thought from standup. thinking, we have these caps that are kinda weird, maybe they'll look better painted. turns out we can't find our spraypaint
see if josh has any?
it's missing... part of me realizes that we have a million other things going on
sorry totally did not hear that.
so, maybe we just scrap it
missing? haha that's classic.
I will be right next to an art supply store and will pick some up. It'll be back here by 1:30 if you want to do it.
if you're down and it's easy, I wouldn't turn it down.

Some notes for tonight, if they’re helpful. *This is a super low-pressure event.* It’s supposed to be fun, and a chance for folks to socialize with the team and see that we actually exist. :slightly_smiling_face:

Basic topics:
* Sommely is a luxury product for people who love wines and wine culture
* Sommely is a system for discovering and managing wine.
* It includes a consumer product for wine collectors, a dashboard for wineries, and business intelligence platform for the wine industry
* We’re currently in active design and development with the Sommely and Uncorked teams. (We’re 3D printing things now!!)
* Early product testing will start in late fall, with a limited release at the end of this year. 
* We’re planning for a limited release to 10 wineries and 100 customers by end-of-year.

Do:
* Talk about what you do for the project
* Why you’re excited to be working on it
* What your history is with project, and what Sommely’s history is with Uncorked
* If folks have product feature feedback: smile, nod, and respond with “interesting, thanks…”
* Talk up Uncorked’s capabilities
Don’t:
* Talk timelines and schedule beyond the very coarse dates above
* Talk money, funding, or cost (if you happen to know them)
* Make anything that sounds like a commitment to product or features.
